Class InteractiveConsoleTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.InteractiveConsoleTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooksInteractiveConsoleTest, CitiesInteracitveConsoleTest, OptionalBooksInteractiveConsoleTest, OptionalCitiesInteractiveConsoleTest

    public class InteractiveConsoleTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains some useful methods for testing with the interactive console.
    Since:
    05.01.2015
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Roman Langrehr, Joshua Gleitze

    • Method Detail

      • oneLineTest

        protected void oneLineTest(java.lang.String commands,
               java.lang.String expectedOutput,
               java.lang.String... args0)
        Test interactive console programs that output one line. Calls the main method with optional args0 on the test object and runs all commands on it. Asserts that the output was the expectedOutput.
        Parameters:
        commands - The commands to run on the test object. Every command must be in a single line.
        expectedOutput - What the test object should print on the console. Use System.lineSeparator() when you expect the TestObject to start a new line.
        args0 - The arguments for the main-method

      • oneLineTest

        protected void oneLineTest(java.lang.String commands,
               org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.String> expectedOutputMatcher,
               java.lang.String... args0)
        Tests interactive console programs that output one line. Calls the main method with optional args0 on the test object and runs all commands on it. Asserts that the output matches the expectedOutputMatcher.
        Parameters:
        commands - The commands to run on the test object. Every command must be in a single line
        expectedOutputMatcher - A Matcher that defines what the test object should print on the console. Use System.lineSeparator() when you expect the TestObject to start a new line.

        Example Matcher, "either empty string or new line":
        either(is("")).or(is(System.lineSeparator()))
        args0 - The arguments for the main-method

      • multiLineTest

        protected void multiLineTest(java.lang.String commands,
                 ExpectedResult[] expectedResults,
                 java.lang.String... args0)
        Tests interactive console programs that output multiple lines. Calls the main method with optional args0 on the test object and runs all commands on it. Asserts that each output line matches the expectedResults. Make sure to provide exactly one ExpectedResult for each output line you expect.

        Example:
        Say we expect the main method to output three times "Success!", an empty line afterwards, and then a line starting with "Error,". The call would work like this: 
         ExpectedResult[] expectedResults = new ExpectedResult[] {
      new ExpectedResult("Success!", TestType.SAME),
      new ExpectedResult("Success!", TestType.SAME),
      new ExpectedResult("Success!", TestType.SAME),
      new ExpectedResult(System.lineSeparator(), TestType.SAME),
      new ExpectedResult("Error,", TestType.STARTS_WITH)
 }
 
 multiLineTest(commands, expectedResults, args0);
        Parameters:
        commands - The commands to run on the test object. Every command must be in a single line
        expectedResults - An array containing ExpectedResults, on ExpectedResult for every expected output line. Each line of the output will be asserted to match the corresponding ExpectedResult.
        args0 - The arguments for the main-method

      • crashTest

        protected void crashTest(java.lang.String commands,
             java.lang.String... args0)
        Tests interactive console programs that oshould output a error message. Calls the main method with optional args0 on the test object and runs all commands on it. Asserts that the output started with "Error,".
        NOTE: This method does not allow to call System.exit(1). If you expect the implemented class to do so, call TestObject.allowSystemExit(SystemExitStatus.WITH_GREATER_THAN_0); before.
